body:
Comment 9 by **cgmurray**: 
I thought about this for a while and the root-cause to my confusion is probably related
to that any two different interface-pointers aren't assignable even though the
underlying types are. 
I fully understand the implementation difficulties with support for arbitrary number of
interfaces and why this isn't possible but the implementation detail is actually leaked
to the type-system and that is kind of confusing. 

In concrete terms:
var i *interface{} = &any_interface_type_apart_from_empty
is invalid. 
I can't find any type-system related reasons for this and I assume it's due to the
interface representation.
